hasDitaContent.@value: Vilanterol is predicted to cause hypokalaemia (potentially increasing the risk of torsade de pointes) when given with vernakalant. Manufacturer makes no recommendation.

hasDitaContent.@value: Both vernakalant and vinflunine prolong the QT interval. Most manufacturers advise avoiding the use of two or more drugs that are associated with QT prolongation. Increasing age, female sex, cardiac disease, and some metabolic disturbances (notably hypokalaemia) predispose to QT prolongation.
